patterns.name: Singleton
patterns.description: Ensure a class has only one instance and provide a global point of access.
patterns.prompt_hint: Enforce single instance; hide constructor; provide accessor; avoid globals

patterns.name: Observer
patterns.description: Define a one-to-many dependency so that when one object changes state, all dependents are notified.
patterns.prompt_hint: Decouple subject and observers; notify subscribers; avoid direct calls

patterns.name: Factory Method
patterns.description: Define an interface for creating an object, but let subclasses alter the type of objects that will be created.
patterns.prompt_hint: Create via factory; avoid direct constructors in clients; preserve call sites

patterns.name: Adapter
patterns.description: Allow objects with incompatible interfaces to collaborate by wrapping a class with a compatible interface.
patterns.prompt_hint: Stabilize client API with an adapter; delegate to existing impl; keep diff tiny

contract.inputs: Stable Target interface; client calls unchanged
contract.outputs: Same behavior via Adaptee; no observable changes

patterns.name: Strategy
patterns.description: Define a family of algorithms, encapsulate each one, and make them interchangeable.
patterns.prompt_hint: Extract algorithm interface; inject at seam; no public API change

patterns.name: Layered Architecture
patterns.description: Organize system into presentation, application, domain, and infrastructure layers with strict or relaxed dependencies.
patterns.prompt_hint: Separate presentation/application/domain/infrastructure; depend inward; avoid cross-layer leaks

patterns.name: Hexagonal Architecture
patterns.description: Ports and adapters isolate the domain from external concerns, enabling easy substitution of UIs and infrastructure.
patterns.prompt_hint: Isolate domain via ports/adapters; inject adapters; keep domain pure

patterns.name: Clean Architecture
patterns.description: Entities, use-cases, and interface adapters arranged in concentric layers with dependency rule pointing inward.
patterns.prompt_hint: Entities/use-cases/adapters; dependencies point inward; keep boundaries explicit

patterns.name: Microservices
patterns.description: An approach to developing a single application as a suite of small services, each running in its own process and communicating with lightweight mechanisms.
patterns.prompt_hint: Split by bounded context; independent services; lightweight APIs; avoid shared DB

patterns.name: Event-Driven Architecture
patterns.description: A style built around asynchronous event production, detection, consumption, and reaction.
patterns.prompt_hint: Decouple producers/consumers with events; async handlers; stable event contracts

patterns.name: CQRS
patterns.description: Command Query Responsibility Segregation separates read and write models for scalability and clarity.
patterns.prompt_hint: Separate commands and queries; isolate write and read models; keep models thin

patterns.name: Bridge
patterns.description: Decouple an abstraction from its implementation so the two can vary independently.
patterns.prompt_hint: Separate Abstraction from Implementor; inject Implementor; keep Abstraction API stable

patterns.name: Composite
patterns.description: Compose objects into tree structures to represent part-whole hierarchies.
patterns.prompt_hint: Unify Leaf and Composite under Component; clients treat them uniformly; keep operation names consistent

patterns.name: Decorator
patterns.description: Attach additional responsibilities to an object dynamically as wrappers.
patterns.prompt_hint: Wrap Component; forward call then add behavior; do not modify Component interface

patterns.name: Facade
patterns.description: Provide a unified interface to a set of interfaces in a subsystem.
patterns.prompt_hint: Introduce a thin facade; do not leak subsystem details; keep client API stable

patterns.name: Flyweight
patterns.description: Use sharing to support large numbers of fine-grained objects efficiently.
patterns.prompt_hint: Share intrinsic state; externalize extrinsic; reuse via cache

patterns.name: Front Controller
patterns.description: Centralize request handling by routing and common processing in a single controller.
patterns.prompt_hint: Centralize request handling; route to handlers; share pre/post processing

patterns.name: MVC
patterns.description: Separate concerns into Model, View, and Controller to improve modularity and testability.
patterns.prompt_hint: Separate concerns; keep view passive; controller mediates; avoid coupling; preserve public API

patterns.name: Proxy
patterns.description: Provide a surrogate or placeholder for another object to control access to it.
patterns.prompt_hint: Introduce a surrogate keeping Subject API stable; intercept for caching/logging/security

patterns.name: 3-tier
patterns.description: Layer an application into presentation, logic, and data tiers (example structure).
patterns.prompt_hint: Presentation, logic, data tiers; interfaces between tiers; no backdoor coupling

patterns.name: Chain of Responsibility
patterns.description: Pass requests along a chain of handlers until one handles it.
patterns.prompt_hint: Link handlers; pass request along until handled; add handlers without modifying clients

patterns.name: Chaining Method
patterns.description: Return self from methods to allow call chaining in a fluent interface.
patterns.prompt_hint: Return self for fluent API; keep steps small; avoid surprising side effects

patterns.name: Command
patterns.description: Encapsulate a request as an object, allowing parameterization and queuing.
patterns.prompt_hint: Encapsulate actions as objects; invoker queues/executes; decouple from receiver

patterns.name: Iterator
patterns.description: Provide a way to access elements of an aggregate object sequentially.
patterns.prompt_hint: Provide sequential access; hide collection internals; use iterator protocol

patterns.name: Mediator
patterns.description: Define an object that encapsulates how a set of objects interact.
patterns.prompt_hint: Encapsulate interactions in mediator; components communicate only via mediator

patterns.name: Memento
patterns.description: Capture and externalize an object's internal state so it can be restored later.
patterns.prompt_hint: Snapshot state for restore; keep originator encapsulated; small memento objects

patterns.name: Publish-Subscribe
patterns.description: Publish events to multiple subscribers decoupled from the publisher.
patterns.prompt_hint: Introduce an event bus; decouple publishers and subscribers; no direct calls; keep topics stable

patterns.name: Registry
patterns.description: Keep a central registry of objects or services for lookup.
patterns.prompt_hint: Central lookup API; explicit register/get; avoid implicit globals

patterns.name: Servant
patterns.description: Provide functionality common to a group of classes via a shared servant object.
patterns.prompt_hint: Extract shared functionality into a Servant; inject where needed; do not change client APIs

patterns.name: Specification
patterns.description: Combine business rules by chaining specifications as predicates.
patterns.prompt_hint: Compose predicates with and/or/not; side-effect-free domain rules

patterns.name: State
patterns.description: Allow an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes.
patterns.prompt_hint: Encapsulate states as objects; context delegates; explicit transitions

patterns.name: Template Method
patterns.description: Define the skeleton of an algorithm in a base operation, deferring steps to subclasses.
patterns.prompt_hint: Define algorithm skeleton in base; override steps in subclasses

patterns.name: Visitor
patterns.description: Represent an operation to be performed on elements of an object structure.
patterns.prompt_hint: Separate operations from structures; accept/visit; double-dispatch

patterns.name: Abstract Factory
patterns.description: Provide an interface for creating families of related objects without specifying their concrete classes.
patterns.prompt_hint: Create families of related products; hide concrete classes; keep client decoupled

patterns.name: Builder
patterns.description: Separate the construction of a complex object from its representation.
patterns.prompt_hint: Separate construction from representation; stepwise assemble; final build

patterns.name: Factory
patterns.description: Provide a method to create objects without exposing the creation logic.
patterns.prompt_hint: Expose factory to create products; hide creation logic; keep client decoupled

patterns.name: Prototype
patterns.description: Create new objects by copying an existing object (prototype).
patterns.prompt_hint: Clone existing instance; deep copy as needed; avoid constructors

patterns.name: Object Pool
patterns.description: Reuse a set of initialized objects kept ready to use.
patterns.prompt_hint: Reuse pooled instances; acquire/release API; pre-initialize if needed

patterns.name: Borg
patterns.description: Share state across instances by assigning to the __dict__ of each instance.
patterns.prompt_hint: Share state via shared __dict__; many instances, single state

patterns.name: Lazy Evaluation
patterns.description: Defer computation until the value is needed.
patterns.prompt_hint: Defer computation until needed; cache the result; idempotent access

patterns.name: Blackboard
patterns.description: Collaboratively solve problems using a shared global memory (blackboard).
patterns.prompt_hint: Shared knowledge base; contributors post partial results; coordinator resolves

patterns.name: Graph Search
patterns.description: Implement search algorithms over graph structures (example algorithmic pattern).
patterns.prompt_hint: Scaffold BFS/DFS traversal; pure functions; deterministic iteration

patterns.name: Refactoring Techniques
patterns.description: General catalog of refactoring techniques and best practices.

refactorings.name: Extract Function
refactorings.prompt_hint: Isolate a cohesive block into a named function; pure if possible; keep behavior

refactorings.name: Inline Function
refactorings.prompt_hint: Replace trivial function calls with body at call sites; simplify; preserve behavior

refactorings.name: Change Function Declaration
refactorings.prompt_hint: Rename/reorder parameters or add defaults; maintain backward compatibility

refactorings.name: Extract Class
refactorings.prompt_hint: Move responsibilities to a new class; single responsibility; delegate to preserve API

refactorings.name: Move Function
refactorings.prompt_hint: Relocate function to a more appropriate module/class; update imports; keep behavior

refactorings.name: Move Field
refactorings.prompt_hint: Relocate state to its rightful owner; adjust accessors; maintain invariants

refactorings.name: Encapsulate Variable
refactorings.prompt_hint: Replace direct variable access with getter/setter; enforce invariants

refactorings.name: Encapsulate Collection
refactorings.prompt_hint: Hide collection behind add/remove/iterate API; donâ€™t expose mutable internals

refactorings.name: Decompose Conditional
refactorings.prompt_hint: Extract condition and branches into named functions; improve readability

refactorings.name: Consolidate Conditional Expression
refactorings.prompt_hint: Combine equivalent outcomes; simplify branching without changing behavior

refactorings.name: Replace Temp with Query
refactorings.prompt_hint: Replace temporary variables with a query method; keep intent clear; watch performance

refactorings.name: Replace Conditional with Polymorphism
refactorings.prompt_hint: Eliminate if/else by introducing polymorphic types/strategies; stable interface

refactorings.name: Introduce Parameter Object
refactorings.prompt_hint: Group related parameters into a value object; reduce long parameter lists

refactorings.name: Replace Constructor with Factory Function
refactorings.prompt_hint: Provide a named factory; hide complex construction; make intent explicit

refactorings.name: Replace Loop with Pipeline
refactorings.prompt_hint: Use map/filter/reduce/comprehensions; keep steps clear; preserve order/behavior

refactorings.name: Split Loop
refactorings.prompt_hint: Separate loops by concern; simpler loops; keep overall complexity acceptable

refactorings.name: Split Variable
refactorings.prompt_hint: Use distinct variables for distinct purposes; avoid reuse that obscures intent

refactorings.name: Slide Statements
refactorings.prompt_hint: Move statements to maximize locality and remove duplicates; no behavior change

refactorings.name: Substitute Algorithm
refactorings.prompt_hint: Replace with a clearer algorithm; maintain observed behavior; add tests

refactorings.name: Replace Magic Literal
refactorings.prompt_hint: Introduce named constants/enums for unexplained literals; improve readability
